issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
I can't generate ipa file for my android app with titanium sdk more recent than 3.5.1.
For example if I try with titanium sdk 5.2.2 GA (or 4.0.0) I have the following error: 
[ERROR] :  Failed to run dexer:
[ERROR] :  
[ERROR] :  Error: Unable to access jarfile null
If I try titanium sdk 3.5.1 GA I'm able to generate ipa file, but of course it is not the best solution because the app doesn't work well with such an old sdk version.
I've tried to uninstall and re-install Titanium Appcelerator.
I've also tried to re-install Android SDK.
fields.summary: "Failed to run dexer" error for SDK more recent than 3.5.1
fields.environment:
MAC OSX 10.10.5
Android SDK 6.0
Titanium Sdk 5.2.2
Ti.Cloud module 3.2.10
facebook module 5.0.0
ti.imagefactory version=2.2.1
fh.imagefactory version=1.1

Hi [~freedevcom], I see you are using  facebook module (v 3.0.3) but the latest version is 5.0.0. Could you try with the latest version, please? 

Module link: https://github.com/appcelerator-modules/ti.facebook/releases

Thanks.

Sorry I made a mistake in the first comment. The version is already 5.0.0. I've corrected my comment. You can see it also from the build log:
"/Users/Myproject/Library/Application Support/Titanium/modules/android/facebook/5.0.0/facebook.jar". Have you any other suggestion? Thank you

[~freedevcom], We could not reproduce it using facebook and cloud module with your testing env. Are you using any other module except Facebook and Cloud? Try a build without <android> section in tiapp.xml file, If needed just add that back in later. 

Thanks.
Yes Motiur, I've checked and I use also ti.imagefactory version=2.2.1 and fh.imagefactory version=1.1. Do you think they could be the cause?

Hello, Can you try running the command in terminal 

"ti config android.dx.maxMemory 512M"

Use sudo at first if necessary.

And clean the project and try building again with the latest SDK.

Regards,
Sharif.

[~freedevcom], We believe this is module issue and I have tested using  facebook(v 5.0.0), cloud(v3.2.10) and ti.imagefactory (v2.2.1) module but could not reproduce the error. I did not find fh.imagefactory (v1.1) modue so it's better if you send us a link. Also, you can remove it then compile again. 

And go to  ~/Library/Application Support/Titanium/modules/android/moduelName/version/lib/ here if you see any duplicate libraries then delete one.

Thanks
Here you are the link: https://github.com/freshheads/fh.imagefactory. Thank you

Motiur, after your comment I tried to create a new project, that doesn't use any module, except from ti.cloud. The result is that I have the same problem. I use as deployment target both iOS and android, but I have problems only with android. Do you think I have to try to uninstall and reinstall something?

[~freedevcom],

Sorry for the inconvenience. Now I recommend you to remove the Studio from Applications plus the following for a clean state: 

sudo npm uninstall -g titanium
sudo npm uninstall -g alloy
sudo npm uninstall -g acs
sudo npm uninstall -g appcelerator
sudo rm -rf ~/.appcelerator
sudo rm -rf ~/.titanium

Check your node version and make it compatible according to the doc -http://docs.appcelerator.com/platform/latest/#!/guide/Installing_Node

 Then install CLI manually through the terminal respectively

sudo npm install -g appcelerator
appc use latest
appc setup -l trace
sudo npm install -g alloy
Finally, take a fresh copy of Appcelerator Studio and install it in your machine. It will automatically install all dependencies.
https://web.appcelerator.com/product/studio

Then open the studio and run your application.
